faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Clear your doubts before getting started

items.question: How long does the complete process take?
items.answer: Essential Website: 7-10 business days after content approval. Managed Automation: 10-14 business days for complete setup.

items.question: Do I need to know technology to have a website?
items.answer: No. With the Essential package, we provide 1h of training for basic content management. With Managed, we handle everything for you — you just need to send us text/images when you want to update something.

items.question: What happens after the 1st month of included support (Essential)?
items.answer: The site is yours and stays online for free on Vercel. If you need additional support, we offer packages: €60/hour (ad-hoc) or pre-paid packages with discount.

items.question: Can I change my package later?
items.answer: Yes! If you start with Essential and want to upgrade to Managed, we credit your initial investment (€300 is deducted from the €800 setup). Migration is free.

items.question: How does cancellation of the Managed package work?
items.answer: You can cancel with 30 days notice. Your plan and respective automations end at the end of the last billed period.

items.question: What are "operations" in the Managed package?
items.answer: Each automatic interaction (e.g., form submitted, automatic email, Google Sheets update) consumes 1 operation. 2,500/month equals ~20 interactions/day, sufficient for most local businesses. We monitor usage and notify you if you're near the limit.

items.question: What if I exceed 2,500 operations?
items.answer: We notify you when you reach 80% of the limit. You have two options: upgrade to a higher plan or add +€30 per 1,000 extra operations. Occasional spikes are tolerated (fair use).

items.question: Do you only work in Lisbon?
items.answer: No. We work with clients throughout Portugal and also internationally (support in Portuguese and English). Online or in-person meetings (Lisbon area).

items.question: How do automations work in practice?
items.answer: Essential: Direct buttons (WhatsApp, phone) and forms that send email. Managed: Complete flows — e.g., form → Telegram notification → Google Sheets entry → automatic client email → follow-up reminder.

items.question: Do I own the website and domain?
items.answer: Yes, in both packages. The developed source code is always yours. The domain is registered in your name. Important note: Automations are linked to our Make.com/Zapier accounts. If you cancel Managed, the basic site remains functional, but you lose the automatic features.
